text: I believe when the GCC leaders come
together in a summit and when the Arab
leaders come together in a summit to
take a position on one issue which is
the unacceptability of Iran's behavior
in the region it's a huge statement to
the Iranian people and to the world that
Iran's policies are not acceptable there
are many who worry that this growing war
of words is creating an escalation that
would become impossible to control we
have made it very clear that we don't
want war we have made it very clear that
we don't want escalation but we have
also made it very clear that we cannot
tolerate continued Iranian aggression
against us and our allies in the region
the world has made that position known a
large number of countries have condemned
Iran's actions Iran is subject to
sanctions because of its actions when
observers see the actions taken by your
side including your most important ally
the United States they see you as on a
path to war 1,500 extra American troops
another aircraft carrier diplomats
pulled out of Baghdad they say you're
preparing for war the falling out of the
diplomats American diplomats out of
Baghdad I leave that to the Americans to
explain our understanding is that they
felt a perceived threat from Iranian
allied militias in Baghdad and they
wanted to make sure that their diplomats
were safe with regards to the buildup in
the region America is our most important
strategic Ally America has interests in
the region as to other countries and
America wants to make sure that should
the Iranians do anything foolish that
the ability and the capability is in the
region to deal with it but nobody wants
war including the United States
President Trump has been very clear
about this Saudi Arabia has been very
clear about this we urged the Iranians
to be cautious to show restraint and to
back off from the positions that they
have taken with the Iranians say they
also don't want war in fact they've
asked for dialogue isn't perhaps that
the way out we have said to the Iranians
words don't mean much because they have
been talking for 40 years meanwhile
they've been acting in an aggressive
manner for 40 years we've called for
dialogue so why not take up the offer of
dialogue because we want to see actions
not words but how dangerous is this
moment it's it's it's a very delicate
moment in the history of our region and
we are trying to
everything we can many see danger in
this moment it's such a volatile region
and the this rising war of words and it
the war of words is going to continue
this weekend with all these summits we
have said time and again that we don't
want war we want to avoid it at all cost
the Iranians have to see synthesist if
they want the situation to return to
normal
Iran is repeatedly denied your
accusations of aggression yes Iran's
denial of these accusations is laughable
the Iranians have smuggled weapons these
signatures all over it this is not what
we say this is what the international
investigators have said some say that
you want to provoke Iran into the first
strike so that you can retaliate and
deal with this once and for all that's
not true a war would be damaging to
everybody in the region and we want to
avoid it at all costs and we have made
that very clear but the ball is really
in Iran's court
